title: UK shines 'beacon of remembrance'
description: Candlelight vigils were held across the country in remembrance of those who lost their lives in the pandemic.

title: Brora stun Hearts in one of biggest shocks in Scottish Cup history
description: Highland League Brora Rangers knock last season's beaten finalists, Hearts, out of the Scottish Cup in a huge second-round shock.

title: Newcastle Racecourse sees more drones used by punters
description: Locals complain Covid travel rules are being broken, but flying drones is not illegal, police say.

title: Has Nicola Sturgeon emerged from this crisis unscathed?
description: The first minister's position is stronger than it has been for weeks - but her government has not escaped criticism.

title: British artist's giant painting raises £45m for children's charities
description: British artist Sacha Jafri spent eight months creating the work in isolation in a hotel ballroom.

title: Lockdown hair given to South Shields Covid-19 archive
description: Four people donated the hair they grew through lockdowns to a museum's collection.

title: Oasis contract requesting 'sober-speaking' helpers fetches £4,000
description: The contract was sold by a woman who worked in the music industry, ahead of her retirement.

title: Penzance couple still dancing and playing through pandemic
description: Sally and Ken Gilmour recently celebrated their 60th wedding anniversary.

title: Abortion: Brandon Lewis to take powers over Stormont laws
description: The government says it is acting to uphold legal and human rights duties on abortion.

title: Covid: UK marks one year since the first lockdown
description: A minute's silence is held as part of a national day of reflection for 126,000 Covid deaths.

title: Jobless crisis shows signs of easing but under-25s hit hard
description: The number of workers on UK company payrolls climbed by 200,000 in the three months to February.

title: Former England striker Worthington dies aged 72
description: Former England striker Frank Worthington dies aged 72 following a long illness.

title: Shrewsbury 24: Court of Appeal clears picketers' convictions
description: The 14 men, including actor Ricky Tomlinson, were among 24 charged following pickets in Shrewsbury.

title: Goldman Sachs boss says 'go extra mile' despite 95-hour week
description: David Solomon says "it's great" young analysts told bosses of 95-hour weeks and poor treatment.

title: Coronavirus: Germany imposes Easter lockdown to curb new surge
description: Rising infections have put Germany in a "very serious" situation, Chancellor Angela Merkel says.

title: 'No faith' in FA investigation into former Chelsea coach Williams, say victims
description: Victims of alleged historical racist abuse at Chelsea say they still do not know if former coach Gwyn Williams has been punished by the Football Association.

title: Cineworld to reopen with cinema-first movie deal
description: US cinemas will reopen in April followed by the UK in May, with theatres getting exclusivity over streaming.

title: Covid lockdown: Seven enduring claims fact-checked
description: A year after the first UK lockdown began, there are many who doubt the necessity of such restrictions.

title: Salmond and Sturgeon: What is the controversy all about?
description: The bitter dispute between two central characters in the Scottish independence movement is nearing its climax.

title: England are at 'end of an era' - Ugo Monye
description: Former England wing Ugo Monye says England have to face up to the end of an era and make sweeping changes after the worst Six Nations campaign in a generation.

title: Covid: £5,000 fine for people going on holiday abroad
description: It is due to come into force in England next week as some other lockdown restrictions are eased.

title: Salmond committee criticises 'serious flaws' of Scottish government
description: A committee of MSPs says the female complainers were badly let down by the Scottish government.

title: Colorado shootings: 'We heard boom, boom, boom'
description: A gunman has killed 10 people, including a police officer, in the US state of Colorado.

title: Bobby Brown Jr died of accidental overdose, says coroner
description: The son of singer Bobby Brown was found dead in his home last November.

title: Covid: The Clacton GP who took his staff on holiday with him
description: How the death of a GP led to an "outpouring of love" in the town where he worked.

title: Former Scotland player opens up about over-exercising
description: Tom Philip has spoken about his experience with over-exercising and strict dieting to hide his poor mental health.

title: MOTDx: Grenfell Athletic - the football club trying to heal a community
description: MOTDx visits west London to speak to the members of Grenfell Athletic, a football team founded in the wake of the devastating Grenfell Tower fire in 2017 with the aim of healing the community.

title: Schumacher ready to emulate 'idol' father - but it won't be easy
description: Mick Schumacher starts his Formula 1 career this weekend in Bahrain as a rookie like no other.

title: The Papers: 'Travel ban extended' and 'a day to reflect' on lockdown
description: Britons facing tighter travel restrictions makes the front of some newspapers on the anniversary of the start of lockdown.

title: Covid-19: Vaccines and vaccine passports being sold on darknet
description: Researchers say criminals are taking advantage of desperate people looking for a way out of lockdown

title: Covid: More walking and family chats post-lockdown - poll suggests
description: We've done more walking and worked more from home this year, according to a BBC-commissioned poll.

title: Jack Dorsey's first ever tweet sells for $2.9m
description: The Twitter founder will donate the money to charity after it was bought by a Malaysia-based businessman.

title: Grenfell Tower inquiry: 9 things we now know about the cladding
description: A public inquiry has questioned employees of the metals firm that supplied cladding for Grenfell.

title: Grenfell Tower inquiry: 9 things we now know about the cladding
description: A public inquiry has questioned employees of the metals firm that supplied cladding for Grenfell.

title: Making honey without bees and milk without cows
description: Firms are using fermentation to produce honey and milk and say they can match the taste of the real thing.

title: Waitrose ditches magazines with disposable plastic toys
description: The retailer will not sell magazines with disposable plastic toys after a campaign by a 10-year-old.

title: Dan Gertler: The man at the centre of DR Congo corruption allegations
description: Dan Gertler formed a close relationship with DR Congo's ex-leader, even getting a diplomatic passport.

title: How Iceland clamped down to conquer coronavirus
description: It may be a remote island, but there is a reason why Iceland is proud of its success in tackling the pandemic.

title: Afghanistan: The women killed for working at a TV station.
description: A television station in Afghanistan has sent all of its female employees home after four were killed by extremists.
